entries.detail:
1→# Worker Booking Dashboard
     2→
     3→Worker dashboard showing all bookings with status (pending, accepted, completed, cancelled), job details, and business information. Includes cancel functionality for pending bookings and attendance tracking view.
     4→
     5→## Rationale
     6→Workers need to track their upcoming jobs and manage their schedule. A clear dashboard reduces no-shows by keeping workers informed and organized.
     7→
     8→## User Stories
     9→- As a worker, I want to see my upcoming jobs so that I can plan my week
    10→- As a worker, I want to see which applications were accepted so that I know when to show up
    11→- As a worker, I want to cancel bookings if something comes up so that I don't no-show
    12→
    13→## Acceptance Criteria
    14→- [ ] Workers see all their bookings in one place
    15→- [ ] Booking status is clearly displayed
    16→- [ ] Job details include position, date, time, location, and wage
    17→- [ ] Business information shows company name and verification status
    18→- [ ] Pending bookings can be cancelled
    19→- [ ] Completed bookings show attendance record
    20→- [ ] Notifications alert workers to status changes
    21→

1→import { createServerClient } from '@supabase/ssr'
     2→import { NextResponse, type NextRequest } from 'next/server'
     3→
     4→/**
     5→ * Creates a Supabase client for use in middleware
     6→ * Handles cookies properly for Next.js middleware environment
     7→ */
     8→function createMiddlewareClient(request: NextRequest) {
     9→  const response = NextResponse.next({
    10→    request: { headers: request.headers },
    11→  })
    12→
    13→  const supabase = createServerClient(
    14→    process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL!,
    15→    process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY!,
    16→    {
    17→      cookies: {
    18→        get(name: string) {
    19→          return request.cookies.get(name)?.value
    20→        },
    21→        set(name: string, value: string, options: any) {
    22→          request.cookies.set({ name, value, ...options })
    23→          response.cookies.set({ name, value, ...options })
    24→        },
    25→        remove(name: string, options: any) {
    26→          request.cookies.set({ name, value: '', ...options })
    27→          response.cookies.set({ name, value: '', ...options })
    28→        },
    29→      },
    30→    }
    31→  )
    32→
    33→  return { supabase, response }
    34→}
    35→
    36→/**
    37→ * Routes that don't require authentication
    38→ */
    39→const publicRoutes = [
    40→  '/',
    41→  '/login',
    42→  '/register',
    43→  '/forgot-password',
    44→  '/reset-password',
    45→  '/auth/callback',
    46→]
    47→
    48→/**
    49→ * Routes that require authentication
    50→ */
    51→const protectedRoutes = [
    52→  '/dashboard-business-jobs',
    53→  '/dashboard-worker-jobs',
    54→  '/dashboard/business',
    55→  '/dashboard/worker',
    56→]
    57→
    58→/**
    59→ * Middleware to protect routes
    60→ * Checks for Supabase session and redirects unauthenticated users
    61→ */
    62→export async function middleware(request: NextRequest) {
    63→  const pathname = request.nextUrl.pathname
    64→
    65→  // Get the origin for proper URL construction
    66→  const origin = request.nextUrl.origin
    67→
    68→  // Create Supabase client and get response
    69→  const { supabase, response } = createMiddlewareClient(request)
    70→
    71→  // Check if user has a valid session
    72→  const {
    73→    data: { session },
    74→  } = await supabase.auth.getSession()
    75→
    76→  const isProtectedRoute = protectedRoutes.some((route) =>
    77→    pathname.startsWith(route)
    78→  )
    79→  const isPublicRoute = publicRoutes.some((route) =>
    80→    pathname === route || pathname.startsWith(route)
    81→  )
    82→
    83→  // Redirect unauthenticated users from protected routes to login
    84→  if (isProtectedRoute && !session) {
    85→    const redirectUrl = new URL('/login', origin)
    86→    redirectUrl.searchParams.set('redirect', pathname)
    87→    return NextResponse.redirect(redirectUrl)
    88→  }
    89→
    90→  // Redirect authenticated users away from auth pages to dashboard
    91→  if (isPublicRoute && session) {
    92→    // Check if trying to access login/register while authenticated
    93→    if (pathname === '/login' || pathname === '/register') {
    94→      // Redirect to appropriate dashboard based on user role
    95→      const userRole = session.user?.user_metadata?.role
    96→      if (userRole === 'worker') {
    97→        return NextResponse.redirect(new URL('/dashboard-worker-jobs', origin))
    98→      } else if (userRole === 'business') {
    99→        return NextResponse.redirect(new URL('/dashboard-business-jobs', origin))
   100→      }
   101→      // Default fallback
   102→      return NextResponse.redirect(new URL('/dashboard-worker-jobs', origin))
   103→    }
   104→  }
   105→
   106→  return response
   107→}
   108→
   109→/**
   110→ * Configure which routes the middleware should run on
   111→ * Matches all routes except static files, images, and API routes
   112→ */
   113→export const config = {
   114→  matcher: [
   115→    /*
   116→     * Match all request paths except:
   117→     * - _next/static (static files)
   118→     * - _next/image (image optimization files)
   119→     * - favicon.ico (favicon file)
   120→     * - public files (images, etc.)
   121→     * - API routes (unless you want to protect them)
   122→     */
   123→    '/((?!_next/static|_next/image|favicon.ico|.*\\.(?:svg|png|jpg|jpeg|gif|webp)$).*)',
   124→  ],
   125→}
   126→

     3→  "description": "# Worker Booking Dashboard

Worker dashboard showing all bookings with status (pending, accepted, completed, cancelled), job details, and business information. Includes cancel functionality for pending bookings and attendance tracking view.

## Rationale
Workers need to track their upcoming jobs and manage their schedule. A clear dashboard reduces no-shows by keeping workers informed and organized.

## User Stories
- As a worker, I want to see my upcoming jobs so that I can plan my week
- As a worker, I want to see which applications were accepted so that I know when to show up
- As a worker, I want to cancel bookings if something comes up so that I don't no-show

## Acceptance Criteria
- [ ] Workers see all their bookings in one place
- [ ] Booking status is clearly displayed
- [ ] Job details include position, date, time, location, and wage
- [ ] Business information shows company name and verification status
- [ ] Pending bookings can be cancelled
- [ ] Completed bookings show attendance record
- [ ] Notifications alert workers to status changes

## Planning Complete ✅

I've completed the **Phase 0: Deep Codebase Investigation** and created all necessary planning files for the **Worker Booking Dashboard** feature.

### Files Created

| File | Description |
|------|-------------|
| `project_index.json` | Project structure (Next.js + TypeScript + Supabase) |
| `context.json` | Patterns, files to modify, and existing implementations |
| `implementation_plan.json` | Complete subtask-based implementation plan |
| `init.sh` | Environment setup script |
| `build-progress.txt` | Progress tracking document |

### Implementation Plan Summary

**Workflow Type:** `feature` (5 phases, 7 subtasks)

| Phase | Description | Subtasks |
|-------|-------------|----------|
| 1. UI Foundation | Create BookingStatusBadge and CancelBookingDialog components | 2 |
| 2. Booking Card | Create BookingCard component with job/business details | 1 |
| 3. Booking List | Create BookingList with Supabase data fetching | 1 |
| 4. Main Page | Create `/dashboard/worker/bookings` page | 1 |
| 5. Integration | Update middleware + E2E verification | 2 |

### Key Findings from Investigation

- **Project:** Next.js 14 with App Router, TypeScript, Tailwind CSS, Supabase
- **UI Components:** Shadcn/ui (Card, Button, Badge, Table, Dialog) available
- **Database:** `bookings` table already exists with status enum
- **Auth:** Uses `useAuth()` hook from `auth-provider.tsx`
- **Middleware:** Protected routes array needs new booking route

### Next Steps

A separate **coder agent** will implement the subtasks defined in `implementation_plan.json`. The work will proceed sequentially through the phases, with each subtask verified before completion.

entries.content:
## ✅ Subtask 1-1 Completed

**Created:** `components/worker/booking-status-badge.tsx`

### Implementation Details

The `BookingStatusBadge` component provides color-coded status display for booking states:

- **Pending**: Yellow badge (amber/yellow colors)
- **Accepted**: Blue badge  
- **Completed**: Green badge
- **Cancelled**: Red badge

### Features

- Follows existing `Badge` component patterns using `class-variance-authority`
- Subtle background colors with darker text for better accessibility
- Dark mode support with adjusted text colors
- Proper TypeScript types (`BookingStatus` and `BookingStatusBadgeProps`)
- Status labels map automatically to display text

### Git Commit

```
commit 5863234
auto-claude: subtask-1-1 - Create BookingStatusBadge component with color-coded status display
```

entries.content:
Perfect! Let me provide a summary of what was accomplished:

## ✅ Subtask 3-1 Completed: BookingList Component

### What was created:
- **File:** `components/worker/booking-list.tsx` (173 lines)

### Key Features:
1. **Supabase Data Fetching** - Queries the `bookings` table with joins to `jobs` and `businesses` tables
2. **Status-Based Grouping** - Groups bookings into 4 categories:
   - Pending Bookings
   - Accepted & In Progress
   - Completed
   - Cancelled/Rejected
3. **Loading State** - Shows a spinner while fetching data
4. **Empty State** - Displays a friendly message when no bookings exist
5. **Error Handling** - Toast notifications for fetch and cancel errors (using Indonesian messages for consistency with the codebase)
6. **Cancel Functionality** - Allows cancellation of pending bookings via the BookingCard component
7. **Responsive Layout** - Grid layout that adapts from 1 to 3 columns based on screen size

### Patterns Followed:
- Client-side component with `"use client"` directive
- React hooks (`useState`, `useCallback`, `useEffect`)
- TypeScript type safety
- Supabase query patterns from `auth-provider.tsx`
- Error handling with toast notifications
- Consistent naming conventions and code style

### Verification:
✅ Component created successfully
✅ Verification command passed
✅ Committed to git

The next subtask would be to create the main bookings page that integrates this component.
I'll implement subtask-4-1 to create the worker bookings page. Let me start by verifying my location and reading the pattern files.

1→import { createServerClient } from '@supabase/ssr'
     2→import { NextResponse, type NextRequest } from 'next/server'
     3→
     4→/**
     5→ * Creates a Supabase client for use in middleware
     6→ * Handles cookies properly for Next.js middleware environment
     7→ */
     8→function createMiddlewareClient(request: NextRequest) {
     9→  const response = NextResponse.next({
    10→    request: { headers: request.headers },
    11→  })
    12→
    13→  const supabase = createServerClient(
    14→    process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_URL!,
    15→    process.env.NEXT_PUBLIC_SUPABASE_ANON_KEY!,
    16→    {
    17→      cookies: {
    18→        get(name: string) {
    19→          return request.cookies.get(name)?.value
    20→        },
    21→        set(name: string, value: string, options: any) {
    22→          request.cookies.set({ name, value, ...options })
    23→          response.cookies.set({ name, value, ...options })
    24→        },
    25→        remove(name: string, options: any) {
    26→          request.cookies.set({ name, value: '', ...options })
    27→          response.cookies.set({ name, value: '', ...options })
    28→        },
    29→      },
    30→    }
    31→  )
    32→
    33→  return { supabase, response }
    34→}
    35→
    36→/**
    37→ * Routes that don't require authentication
    38→ */
    39→const publicRoutes = [
    40→  '/',
    41→  '/login',
    42→  '/register',
    43→  '/forgot-password',
    44→  '/reset-password',
    45→  '/auth/callback',
    46→]
    47→
    48→/**
    49→ * Routes that require authentication
    50→ */
    51→const protectedRoutes = [
    52→  '/dashboard-business-jobs',
    53→  '/dashboard-worker-jobs',
    54→  '/dashboard/business',
    55→  '/dashboard/worker',
    56→]
    57→
    58→/**
    59→ * Middleware to protect routes
    60→ * Checks for Supabase session and redirects unauthenticated users
    61→ */
    62→export async function middleware(request: NextRequest) {
    63→  const pathname = request.nextUrl.pathname
    64→
    65→  // Get the origin for proper URL construction
    66→  const origin = request.nextUrl.origin
    67→
    68→  // Create Supabase client and get response
    69→  const { supabase, response } = createMiddlewareClient(request)
    70→
    71→  // Check if user has a valid session
    72→  const {
    73→    data: { session },
    74→  } = await supabase.auth.getSession()
    75→
    76→  const isProtectedRoute = protectedRoutes.some((route) =>
    77→    pathname.startsWith(route)
    78→  )
    79→  const isPublicRoute = publicRoutes.some((route) =>
    80→    pathname === route || pathname.startsWith(route)
    81→  )
    82→
    83→  // Redirect unauthenticated users from protected routes to login
    84→  if (isProtectedRoute && !session) {
    85→    const redirectUrl = new URL('/login', origin)
    86→    redirectUrl.searchParams.set('redirect', pathname)
    87→    return NextResponse.redirect(redirectUrl)
    88→  }
    89→
    90→  // Redirect authenticated users away from auth pages to dashboard
    91→  if (isPublicRoute && session) {
    92→    // Check if trying to access login/register while authenticated
    93→    if (pathname === '/login' || pathname === '/register') {
    94→      // Redirect to appropriate dashboard based on user role
    95→      const userRole = session.user?.user_metadata?.role
    96→      if (userRole === 'worker') {
    97→        return NextResponse.redirect(new URL('/dashboard-worker-jobs', origin))
    98→      } else if (userRole === 'business') {
    99→        return NextResponse.redirect(new URL('/dashboard-business-jobs', origin))
   100→      }
   101→      // Default fallback
   102→      return NextResponse.redirect(new URL('/dashboard-worker-jobs', origin))
   103→    }
   104→  }
   105→
   106→  return response
   107→}
   108→
   109→/**
   110→ * Configure which routes the middleware should run on
   111→ * Matches all routes except static files, images, and API routes
   112→ */
   113→export const config = {
   114→  matcher: [
   115→    /*
   116→     * Match all request paths except:
   117→     * - _next/static (static files)
   118→     * - _next/image (image optimization files)
   119→     * - favicon.ico (favicon file)
   120→     * - public files (images, etc.)
   121→     * - API routes (unless you want to protect them)
   122→     */
   123→    '/((?!_next/static|_next/image|favicon.ico|.*\\.(?:svg|png|jpg|jpeg|gif|webp)$).*)',
   124→  ],
   125→}
   126→

entries.content: Now let me update the implementation plan to mark this subtask as completed:

entries.detail:
1→{
     2→  "feature": "Worker Booking Dashboard",
     3→  "description": "# Worker Booking Dashboard\n\nWorker dashboard showing all bookings with status (pending, accepted, completed, cancelled), job details, and business information. Includes cancel functionality for pending bookings and attendance tracking view.\n\n## Rationale\nWorkers need to track their upcoming jobs and manage their schedule. A clear dashboard reduces no-shows by keeping workers informed and organized.\n\n## User Stories\n- As a worker, I want to see my upcoming jobs so that I can plan my week\n- As a worker, I want to see which applications were accepted so that I know when to show up\n- As a worker, I want to cancel bookings if something comes up so that I don't no-show\n\n## Acceptance Criteria\n- [ ] Workers see all their bookings in one place\n- [ ] Booking status is clearly displayed\n- [ ] Job details include position, date, time, location, and wage\n- [ ] Business information shows company name and verification status\n- [ ] Pending bookings can be cancelled\n- [ ] Completed bookings show attendance record\n- [ ] Notifications alert workers to status changes",
     4→  "workflow_type": "feature",
     5→  "workflow_rationale": "This is a feature workflow because we are building new functionality (booking dashboard) from scratch. The implementation follows UI component dependency order: status badge → cancel dialog → booking card → booking list → main page. All work is frontend-only as Supabase schema already exists.",
